description.narrative: Guarantee legal assistance for political prisoners being held at Coronel Oviedo, strengthen the commission and alliances with social organizations, and maintain the continuous presence of a lawyer in the communities of the victims to inform the commission about the details of the judicial process. These prisoners are facing charges of intentional murder, trespassing, and being behind the conspiracy that led to the June 15th massacre of Curuguaty in Marina Kue (Campos Morombi). However, they and their families have scarce resources to and cannot afford a defense. They live in poverty and are essentially farmers without land. The group is trying to help these 14 imprisoned people get access to legal representation who can track the process, study the charges, prepare a strategy of defense, and communicate the judicial process to the families and partner organization Via Campesina. The group will communicate the legal process to international and national civil society organizations by printing reports, dossiers, brochures or magazines. Peasant farmers in the department of Canindeyu have been targeted and criminalized for resisting the expansion of transgenic industrial soy production which threatens their environment, agricultural diversity, and food security.
